I have no sympathy for you due to my natural affection, affection, love and admiration for you. I have a firm resolve to provide. Therefore, I have the right to and am in possession of the following immovable property valued at Rs. 4,85,000-00 (literally, four lakh eighty-five thousand rupees) as per the schedule below, and I have given it to you as a gift without any consideration and have taken possession of the said property this day. All the rights and interests that I have had over this property till now shall belong to you as of this date and shall not be vested in me, my siblings, their heirs or any other person. As of this date, you shall transfer the property as per the schedule in your name to the Revenue and Panchayat, Electricity City Transferred in 3 accounts and entered in the schedule, the property should be kept in your possession and enjoyed without interruption with all rights, namely donation, deed, exchange, sale, enjoyment, mortgage, etc. with all complete rights and liabilities. That is my personal resignation and written and written donation document.

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No 1113 of 2026 dated 27/Jan/2026, executed by Manjula in favour of her Husband, B. Narasimha Murthy, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 113.47 Sq. Yds, bearing house number 6-8, comprised in survey number 283-2 situated in Beechiganipalle Village and Grama Panchayat, Patraganipalli Area, Parigi Mandal, within the District of Sri Sathya Sai registered at sub-registrar office Hindupur(1207) is bounded as follows: Schedule 1 - Boundaries as per the Deed North by: Panchayat Road South by: Somashekar House East by: Open Site of Shankarappa West by: My Own Open Site
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note:: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
